Inline conditionals are written into the text by hand. They start with a curled bracket and a flag to test, then a colon, and then some text. You can add alternative text by adding a vertical stroke character (|). The conditional ends with a closing curled bracket.
For example, { Flag A: this only prints if Flag A is true,}  { Flag A: while this has alternatives | this prints if Flag A isn't true}.
